com.googlecode.aluminumproject.configuration
Class DefaultConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.configuration.DefaultConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configuration
public class DefaultConfiguration
extends Object
implements Configuration

A default configuration. It is created with a number of initialisation parameters, which determines which configuration elements will be used.

The configuration elements will be created using the default configuration element factory, although a different implementation can be used by providing a value for the "configuration.default.configuration_element_factory.class" parameter.

For the converter registry, the configuration will look for a parameter with the name "configuration.default.converter_registry.class". If the parameter exists, its value will be interpreted as the class name of the converter registry. If the parameter is absent, the converter registry will default to a default converter registry.

The template element factory is configured in the same way - if a configuration parameter with "configuration.default.template_element_factory.class" as name is present, its value will be used as template element factory class name. If the parameter is not given, a default template element factory will be used.

The default template finder factory and template store finder factory are a class path template finder factory and an in-memory template store finder factory, respectively; other implementations can be configured through the "configuration.default.template_finder_factory.class" and "configuration.default.template_store_finder_factory.class" parameters.

For the cache, the configuration will look for a parameter with the name "configuration.default.cache.class". If the parameter exists, its value will be interpreted as the class name of the cache. If the parameter does not exist, no cache will be used.

To find libraries, the configuration scans a number of packages. By default, a single package is used: com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries. This list can be changed by supplying a configuration parameter named "configuration.default.library.packages". This configuration parameter should contain a comma-separated list of packages that should be included when searching libraries.

Parsers and serialisers are found in a list of packages as well. The default packages that are being looked in are com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers and com.googlecode.aluminumproject.serialisers, though different sets of packages can be configured by using the "configuration.default.parser.packages" and "configuration.default.serialiser.packages" parameters. The values should be a list of packages, separated by a comma, that should be scanned for parsers or serialisers.

When a parser or serialiser is found, it is named after the last part of the package it's in: this means that a parser named com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.simple.SimpleParser or a serialiser named com.googlecode.aluminumproject.serialisers.simple.SimpleSerialiser will be registered under the name simple. This behaviour can be changed by annotating a parser or serialiser with @Named.

Expression factories are found by looking into a list of packages. This list is taken from the configuration parameter "configuration.default.expression_factory.packages" (its value is expected to be a comma-separated package list). If the configuration parameter is not specified, the package com.googlecode.aluminumproject.expressions will be scanned.

It's possible to extend the lists of packages that are used to find libraries, parsers, serialisers, and expression factories in by supplying a configuration parameter with the name "configuration.default.configuration_element.packages". Its value is expected to be a comma-separated list of packages. Other classes that find configuration elements in one or more packages are encouraged to use this configuration parameter as well.

Configuration elements that are found through a package scan are excluded from the configuration when they are annotated with @Ignored.
